questions.question_text: When you choose to scale your Autonomous Database, which statement is true in regards to OCPUs and storage?

choices.D: OCPUs and storage can be scaled independently.
choices.A: Storage in TB cannot be larger than the number of OCPUs.
choices.B: OCPUs and storage must remain in sync.
choices.C: Increasing OCPUs will automatically increase storage.

questions.answer_description:
You simply specify the number of OCPUs and the storage capacity in TB's for the database. At any time, you may scale, increase or decrease either the OCPUs or the storage capacity.
Reference:
https://www.oracle.com/database/technologies/datawarehouse-bigdata/adb-faqs.html

discussion.content: ADB is self driving - independent scaling of CPU and storage

choices.E: Specify the point in time (timestamp) to restore.
choices.A: Backup and recovery must be done using Recovery Manager(RMAN).
choices.B: Select the snapshot of the backup.
choices.D: Select the backup from which restore needs to be done.

questions.question_text: Which two options are available to restore an Autonomous Data Warehouse? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Ans: DE

In the Restore prompt, select Specify Timestamp or Select Backup to restore to a point in time or to restore from a specified backup.

Reference: https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-data-warehouse-cloud/user/backkup-recover.html#GUID-78C28C41-AA87-4AD7-BEB6- 693235C73F3C

questions.answer_description:
In the Restore prompt, select Specify Timestamp or Select Backup to restore to a point in time or to restore from a specified backup.
Reference:
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-data-warehouse-cloud/user/backkup-recover.html#GUID-78C28C41-AA87-4AD7-BEB6-
693235C73F3C

questions.question_text: Which is NOT required to connect to Autonomous Database from SQL developer?
What are the two methods that could be used during the migration of your existing Oracle database to Autonomous Database? (Choose two.)

choices.C: CSV files copied to Autonomous Database block storage

discussion.content: Correct Answer: A and D are okay.
A & D are the correct answers
A and D are correct Answers.

comments.content: RMAN is not supported in ATP

questions.question_text: Which of these database features is NOT part of the Autonomous Database?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
ADB does not support JAva

Selected Answer: D
I think D because it doesn't say Not Supported, it says "is NOT part..."

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbdg/#articletitle

Oracle Database Features That Are Not Supported
Autonomous Database supports most of the features present in Oracle Database Enterprise Edition. However, to ensure the security and the performance of Autonomous Database, the following Oracle Database features, options, and packs are not supported in Autonomous Database.

Application containers
Clusters (groups of tables)

In the link below it is mentioned clearly that Java in DB is limited supported. You can also see a list of all the features which are not supported. 
Based on this I think the Answer is: D

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/atp-cloud/atpdg/experienced-database-users.html#GUID-11ABDC70-C99F-48E4-933B-C7D588E4320A
The answer is C. RAC is not supported in shared or dedicated ADB
RAC is not part of Autonomous Database
C is the correct answer. RAC is not supported for BM and Autonomous Database

Looks like C. 
About D, looks like it is supported but has perf impact.
Database sessions that use Java in Oracle Database will experience reduced database-side performance when service maintenance operations are being performed on the database.

comments.content:
C if ATP, C and D if ADW. Question just says autonomous db which can be either.
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/atp-cloud/atpdg/experienced-database-users.html#GUID-11ABDC70-C99F-48E4-933B-C7D588E4320A
Oracle RAC is an important element in Oracle’s cloud offerings. Oracle RAC is available in the Oracle RAC Database Cloud Service (DBCS), Oracle Exadata Service, and Autonomous Database
Oracle RAC is an important element in Oracle’s cloud offerings. Oracle RAC is available in the Oracle RAC Database Cloud Service (DBCS), Oracle Exadata Service, and Autonomous Database

discussion.content:
Java has restricted feature while RAC is not at all supported feature. 
Ans is C
